summary: This is a standard Office of the Inspector General voluntary interview form used to document warnings and assurances given to an employee being asked to provide information as part of an investigation. The form includes a waiver section for the employee to sign, indicating their understanding and willingness to participate.
keyFacts: The document is an OIG Form 111.226/2 dated 05/03/21, used for non-custodial employee interviews.
The form outlines that the interview is voluntary, no disciplinary action will be taken for refusal to answer, and statements may be used in future criminal or disciplinary proceedings.
The investigation pertains to an unspecified matter, as the subject line appears garbled or redacted in the provided text.
The form includes a waiver section for the employee to sign, confirming no promises, threats, pressure, or coercion were used.
The document is part of an OIG investigation conducted under the Inspector General Act of 1978.
